) The Taxpayer Advocate Service (TAS) is an independent organization within the Internal Revenue Service (IRS), led by the National Taxpayer Advocate. job is to protect taxpayers’ rights by striving to ensure that every taxpayer is treated fairly and knows and understands their rights under the Taxpayer Bill Rights (TBOR). TAS offers free help to taxpayers, including when taxpayers face ﬁnancial difficulties due to an IRS problem, when they are unable to resolve tax problems they haven’t been able to resolve on their own, or they need assistance to address an IRS system, process, or procedure that not functioning as it should. TAS has at least one taxpayer advocate office located in every state, the District of Columbia, and Puerto Rico. (
